noun.description: A sum of money due as one of several equal payments for something, spread over an agreed period of time.
examples: the first installment of a grant for housing
the purchase price is paid in installments

noun.description: Any of several parts of something which are published, broadcast, or made public in sequence at intervals.
examples: filming the final installment in his Vietnam trilogy

noun.description: The process of installing something; installation.
examples: installment will begin early next year

origin: Mid 18th century (denoting the arrangement of payment by installments): alteration of obsolete estalment (probably by association with installation), from Anglo-Norman French estalement, from Old French estaler to fix.
